awards.title: Active Intelligence Research Challenge
awards.summary: I was selected as the recipient of the Active Intelligence Research Challenge Award, as nominated by Dr Lei Wang, for my outstanding research and achievements in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

awards.title: Chancellor’s International Scholarship
awards.summary: I was awarded this prestigious scholarship from the Australian National University in recognition of my academic excellence. It provides a partial tuition fee waiver and this competitive scholarship is offered to outstanding international students globally.

publications.name: TrackNetV4: Enhancing Fast Sports Object Tracking with Motion Attention Maps
publications.summary: This paper introduces TrackNetV4, an enhancement of the TrackNet series for tracking high-speed objects like tennis balls and shuttlecocks. It addresses challenges in partial occlusion and low visibility by combining visual features with learnable motion attention maps through a motion-aware fusion mechanism. This method emphasizes key motion areas, improving tracking accuracy significantly. Experimental results confirm that TrackNetV4 enhances the performance of TrackNetV2 and V3 on relevant datasets.

publications.name: Advancing Video Anomaly Detection: A Concise Review and a New Dataset
publications.publisher: To Appear in NeurIPS 2024 Datasets and Benchmarks Track
publications.summary: This paper reviews Video Anomaly Detection (VAD), focusing on its applications and the need for concise resources for researchers. It highlights the importance of dataset quality in model performance and introduces the Multi-Scenario Anomaly Detection (MSAD) dataset, featuring 14 diverse scenarios. This dataset aims to improve anomaly detection across varying conditions and supports recent model analyses to address VAD challenges effectively.

publications.name: Comparing Computer Resource Usage Through Interpolating Global Ecosystem Dynamics Investigation Light Detection and Ranging Waveform Data
publications.publisher: International Conference for Advancement in Technology (ICONAT)
publications.summary: This study compares the computational resources used by cubic and linear splines for modeling waveforms with NASA's GEDI LiDAR data. It evaluates the efficiency and applicability of these interpolation methods for GEDI and similar datasets, aiming to guide researchers in model creation and efficiency for large-scale artificial intelligence applications.

skills.name: IT and Software Dev
keywords: MS Power Apps and Office Suite

volunteer.summary: I am the delegated ANU client on behalf of Dr. Lei Wang. Here, I guide six students on a machine learning project focused on developing an advanced computer vision system that analyzes the dynamics of tennis swings.

I oversee the overall digital operations of the TIME Lab, ensuring everything runs smoothly across various platforms. From website development and management to social media postings, I handle the lab’s online presence and communications. I also manage day-to-day operations, email correspondence, and external communications, making sure the lab’s activities are effectively conveyed and its digital presence remains cohesive and engaging.

In this role, I organise talks about research opportunities, skills, and topics. Additionally, I organise laboratory/facility tours to expose members to how research is conducted in different disciplines.

volunteer.position: Project Lead <- IT Lead <- IT/Business Member
volunteer.summary: Led an interdisciplinary team of ANU students in one of the university's largest clubs, progressing through various roles from IT/Business Member to IT Lead to Project Lead
highlights: Project Lead: I led a 40+ member team towards their first race, managing a budget of 30K+ AUD, handling risks, tasks, conflicts, and securing sponsorships like Bosch.
IT Lead: I set up the Autonomous Racing Car project, handled IT operations, and implemented automation processes.
IT/Business Member: I designed automation systems, maintained the website, and secured sponsorships to support the team.
